questions.question_text: What does physical access control regulate?

discussion.content: *Facilities* is the key word here, as it is solely Physical, the other options can be breached via the network as well.
A B and D smh
If this was multiple choice question it would be A, B and D. But as Darkk say the key word here is "Facilities". And it is single answer so i think answer A is correct.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

questions.question_text: A network engineer is asked to configure VLANS 2, 3, and 4 for a new implementation. Some ports must be assigned to the new VLANS with unused ports remaining. Which action should be taken for the unused ports?

discussion.content: Leave it to cisco to use terminology that engineers of many years have never heard or used... smh

Selected Answer: C
A black hole VLAN is a virtual LAN that is configured on a network switch, but it is not connected to any device or port. Traffic that is sent to a port in a black hole VLAN is discarded, effectively "sinking" into a "black hole." Black hole VLANs are sometimes used as a security measure to isolate or quarantine certain ports or devices, or to prevent unauthorized access or traffic on a network.

Selected Answer: C
I have black hole when I am reading this questions ....

Selected Answer: C
C is correct
i honestly never heard about the black hole

comments.content:
Option 'c' is correct.
Placing unused ports into a "black hole" effectively isolates them from the network.
No IP address is applied to the SVI, so they cannot access any infrastructural equipment.
Basic CCNA Security question, which *is* within scope of CCNA.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
should be D

comments.content: Yes, this question is a CCNA 200-301 one

discussion.content: no CCNA scope
black hole lang ni enigma alam ko e
so...answer A :configure in "non-default native VLAN" has the same meaning as blackhole vlan except omitting one more step to shut it down
unused so goes directly to Black hole.

Selected Answer: C
Some administrators take unused ports a step further by creating a black hole VLAN. This is a VLAN that's local to this switch only, has no layer 3 switch virtual interface (SVI) configured for it, and isn't allowed to traverse an uplink trunk port

Selected Answer: C
C is correct!
A black hole is a vlan that is unused where you put unused ports in or hosts that you dont want to be on the network.

choices.B: configure ports in the native VLAN
choices.A: configure in a nondefault native VLAN
choices.C: configure ports in a black hole VLAN

questions.question_text: When a WPA2-PSK WLAN is configured in the Wireless LAN Controller, what is the minimum number of characters that is required in ASCII format?

discussion.content:
WPA preshared keys must contain 8 to 63 ASCII text characters or 64 hexadecimal characters

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/7-4/configuration/guides/consolidated/b_cg74_CONSOLIDATED/b_cg74_CONSOLIDATED_chapter_01010001.html

Selected Answer: B
B is correct
